characters.name: Capper
characters.description: Capper is a male anthropomorphic cat who appears as a supporting character in My Little Pony The Movie. He also appears in the IDW comics and the season nine episodes Between Dark and Dawn and The Last Problem. He is a Klugetown con artist and former aristocrat from Abyssinia. He is called Capper Dapperpaws in some merchandise.

characters.name:
The Boss
Charlie
characters.description: Addressed on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #47 page 3. In The Official Movie Sourcebook.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Chummer
characters.description: Capper's best friend in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issues #1-3. In the third issue, he betrays Capper and tries to abandon him in Klugetown. In the fourth issue, his paw prints appear on pages 2-3. In Gameloft's mobile game, "Chummer and Capper used to be friends". His in-game description states, "True to his name, he was once Capper's friend -- though their bond wasn't one that would last, in the end." Visually based on Andy Price's cat Bela Lugosi; see also Bela.

characters.name: Sweeps
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: The Enlightenment Broker
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Garnet Flash
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Grumm
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook;​[​specify​]​ conflated with Pushkin despite significant physical difference.

characters.name:
Klugetown Citizen
Louise
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Lizard Vendor" in the film's script. Named Louise in Gameloft's mobile game, the same as a harp. Her in-game description states, "When Klugetowners work up a serious thirst, they go to her cafe. It isn't... the worst." Named Klugetown Citizen on Enterplay collectible card game Seaquestria & Beyond expansion set card #96 C. Voiced.

characters.name:
Klugetown Vendor
Mori
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. The film's script capitalizes Grubber's line regarding him as "Oh, Fishman just got dropped!" but otherwise refers to him simply as "Giant Vendor". Named Mori in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "Everypony's favorite hypochondriac fish-creature. Also: everypony's ONLY hypochondriac fish-creature." Named Klugetown Vendor on Enterplay collectible card game Seaquestria & Beyond expansion set card #90 U. Voiced by Peter New.

characters.name: Needy
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown, sent by Capper to fetch Verko during I'm the Friend You Need. Identified in The Art of My Little Pony: The Movie as Needy.

characters.name: Puce Sharptooth
characters.description: In The Official Movie Sourcebook.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Pushkin
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Barrel Vendor" in the film's script. Conflated with Grumm in The Official Movie Sourcebook despite significant physical difference. Named Pushkin in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "This cargo transporter has got a HUGE shell. Don't get in his way or he'll give you a yell!" Shares his design with MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #15. Voiced.

characters.name: Vera
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Bald Vendor" in the film's script. Named Vera in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "She's looking to do something new with her hair -- maybe steal the mane off a gullible mare!" Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Verko
characters.description: A Klugetown crime boss in My Little Pony The Movie, My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #3, and Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Brian Dobson.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #1
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Bird Vendor #2" in the film's script. Voiced.

characters.name:
Klugetown Pest-Catcher
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #2
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Bird Vendor #1" in the film's script. He is a character called "Klugetown Pest-Catcher" in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "That net has really big holes in it -- so he's only good at catching REALLY big pests." Voiced​[​specify​]​.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #3
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown, interested in buying Twilight Sparkle's horn. Referred to as "Horn Vendor" in the film's script. Voiced.

characters.name:
Klugetown Basketweaver
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #4
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Named "Klugetown Basketweaver" in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "Klugetown's first choice for creatures who'd like to buy something to hold other things with. At least he knows his niche!"

characters.name:
Toothy Klugetowner
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #5
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Referred to as "Long-Necked Vendor" in the film's script. Named Toothy Klugetowner in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "We're not ones to judge a guy based on his fin, but when he's in the water... try not to go in." Voiced​[​specify​]​.

characters.name:
Klugetown Wool-Seller
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #6
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Named Klugetown Wool-Seller in Gameloft's mobile game. Shares his design with Earnest Klugetowner. Voiced during I'm the Friend You Need by Vincent Tong.

characters.name:
Hefty Klugetowner
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #7
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Named "Hefty Klugetowner" in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "Whatever you do, don't call him an 'overgrown grape.' He's heard it before, and it really hurts his feelings."

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #8
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown.

characters.name:
Spiky Klugetowner
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #9
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Named Spiky Klugetowner in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "That prickly 'hairdo' takes HOURS to brush. Maybe she should consider using product?"

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #10
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #11
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown.

characters.name:
Scaly Klugetowner
MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #12
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Named Scaly Klugetowner in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "We wonder what's inside that basket of fruit -- though since we can't pay her, the question is moot." Voiced during I'm the Friend You Need by Sam Vincent.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #13
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #14
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown.

characters.name: MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #15
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as an anthropomorphic resident of Klugetown. Shares design with Pushkin.

characters.name:
Earnest Klugetowner
​[​specify​]​
characters.description: Named Earnest Klugetowner in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "Compared to his neighbors, he's really quite tender -- or maybe he's hiding some hidden agenda." Shares his design with MLPTM Unnamed Klugetowner #6.

characters.name:
Klugetown Potter
​[​specify​]​
characters.description: She is a character called "Klugetown Potter" in Gameloft's mobile game.
